meanings.definition: Suffer death, typically in a violent, sudden, or untimely way.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight perished in battle against the dragon.
meanings.sent2: Many dinosaurs perished when a massive asteroid hit the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone perished in the sun before I could eat it.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a famous singer perished when she lost her voice.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization perished in a catastrophic volcanic eruption.

meanings.sent1: The old building perished in the fire that swept through the town.
meanings.sent2: Without water, the plants in the garden quickly perished.
meanings.sent3: My hopes of winning the contest perished when I realized I forgot to enter.
meanings.sent4: The pirate ship perished at the bottom of the ocean, lost to the depths.
meanings.sent5: The fragile sandcastle perished as the tide came in, washing it away.
